thread.title: Bruce Springsteen knocks Donald Trump with a cover of 'Don't Hang Up' in Australia
thread.title_full: Bruce Springsteen knocks Donald Trump with a cover of 'Don't Hang Up' in Australia

author: Rachel Desantis
title: Bruce Springsteen knocks Donald Trump with a cover of 'Don't Hang Up' in Australia
text:
Email Gilbert Carrasquillo/FilmMagic 
Bruce Springsteen has long been an outspoken critic of Donald Trump, and the musician took his feelings to the stage at a recent concert in Australia when he performed a cover of Orlons’ classic ’60s song “Don’t Hang Up.” The song choice followed Trump’s heated phone call with Australian prime minister Malcolm Turnbull , in which the president hung up on Turnbull. 
Springsteen addressed the controversy in Melbourne on Thursday, telling the audience, “We stand before you embarrassed Americans tonight. This is a song from 1965 by the Orlons. We’re going to use this to send a letter back home.” 
Reports of the phone call in question emerged Wednesday night, with news outlets reporting that the leaders of the U.S. and Australia, who have long been allies, got into an argument over refugee policy, which led Trump to end the call abruptly. 
Additionally, the president took to Twitter to denounce the policy agreement, which would see the U.S. accept 1,250 refugees , as “dumb.” Do you believe it? The Obama Administration agreed to take thousands of illegal immigrants from Australia. Why? I will study this dumb deal! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 2, 2017 
Watch the video of Springsteen’s performance below. Show Full Article
